node.title: Girl, 4, among NT's three new local COVID-19 cases, 72-hour mask mandates for Tennant Creek and remote communities
node.alt: The quiet main street of Katherine during a COVID-19 lockdown.
node.description: The Northern Territory has recorded three more local COVID-19 cases overnight, including in a four-year-old girl, as a 72-hour mask mandate comes into place in Tennant Creek and five remote communities after positive wastewater results.
node.content: ["The Northern Territory has recorded three\u00a0new local cases of COVID-19 in the past 24 hours, including in a four-year-old girl, as a 72-hour mask mandate\u00a0comes into\u00a0place in Tennant Creek and five remote communities after\u00a0positive wastewater results.", "Northern Territory\u00a0Health Minister Natasha Fyles today said all of the new cases had been recorded in the town of Katherine, where the Territory's local outbreak began more than a month ago.", "A four-year-old girl from\u00a0the Katherine East area, who is a family contact of a case detected last week, is one of the people who has tested positive.", "Ms Fyles said the girl\u00a0has\u00a0been in the\u00a0Howard Springs quarantine facility throughout her infectious period.\u00a0", "Two other girls in Katherine East, aged 15 and 17, have also tested positive.", "Ms Fyles said the teenagers had tested positive during a targeted COVID \"testing blitz\" conducted by health workers in the Acacia Road area, where last week's positive case resides.", "It's understood they are not related.", "The two girls\u00a0will be transported to Howard Springs to undergo quarantine.", "Ms Fyles said wastewater samples from a number of catchments in\u00a0Katherine were continuing to test positive for COVID-19.", "There have also been positive wastewater results overnight from five of the remote communities surrounding\u00a0Katherine: Bulla, Daguragu, Pigeonhole, Kalkarindji and Lajamanu.", "A 72-hour mask mandate is now in place for those communities and surrounding homelands.", "A weak detection of COVID-19 has also been found in wastewater in Tennant Creek, Ms Fyles said, prompting\u00a0a\u00a072-hour mask mandate in the town.", "More to come."]
